instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi guys

Got a 2015 MBP 820-000138-A board in. Had liquid damage (vinegarette!) to the LVDS area. Cleaned all the junk off, replaced all of the caps next to the LVDS as they were falling off (!) and replaced the LVDS connector itself.

Getting no display on LCD (external display is fine) and no voltage at Pin 1 of the LVDS.

Struggling a bit because there isn't a boardview for this model, the 'similar' one (I forget the board) doesn't have the same configuration around the LVDS area.

Original LVDS cable had Pin 1 burnt out, have tried replacing the cable to the LCD and have also got a new LCD here to test with.

No display is showing behind the Apple logo with a torch, although I don't know if the Retina displays would show that?

Where best to start folks!?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Looks like unrecognized LCD.
J8300 must get voltage at pins 5 and 28-30 at least few seconds when board starts; even if LCD is not connected.
For LCD to be correctly recognized, pin 9 must go high; only when LCD is connected.
If not, mentioned voltages will drop.
Check L/<RESISTOR>R8300</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>/10 volatges.
Check all J8300 connections to corresponding components.
